laboratory_examinations.findings: Slightly elevated CRP of 20.5 mg/L, normal levels of cortisol and TSH.
Negative for antinuclear antibodies, rheumatoid factors, anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide, and anti-Scl70.
SUVmax on fascia was 12.3 and on subcutaneous nodules was 9.5, diffuse tracer uptake on the synovial walls of both knees.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Appearance and subsequent increase of subcutaneous and fascial hypermetabolism.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Histologic analysis revealed panniculitis with septal inflammation, mostly composed of lymphocytes and few histiocytes, vessels well seen and without vasculitis.
